tutorial.title: Intro to Node.js
tutorial.descriptionContent: Dive into the world of NodeJS and NPM before using it with React and Express

lessons.title: NodeJS
lessons.interactiveContent:
Node, short for Node.js, is an open-source runtime for running JavaScript outside the browser.

Server-side applications using JavaScript run mostly on Node.

lessons.title: NodeJS 2 - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
So far, we've used Node to execute JavaScript outside of the browser environment. Going forward, you'll also use it to run servers.

Node enables us to build fast, scalable, and efficient server-side applications using JavaScript.

lessons.title: Installing Node
lessons.interactiveContent:
Mimo enables you to spin up a project without having to handle installing Node.

If you want to use it locally, you can check your version. Type node -v in a terminal. v stands for version. This will show your version.

Make sure to pick node, followed by -v.

lessons.title: Node Packages
lessons.interactiveContent:
Node comes with the Node Package Manager (NPM), a tool that allows you to install, manage, and share libraries and dependencies easily.

Type npm install x to install the package called x.

Make sure to pick npm, followed by install, and finally x.

lessons.title: NPM
lessons.interactiveContent:
NPM manages the installation of packages from a repository of public Node packages known as the NPM registry.

Node installation includes NPM. To check its version, use the command npm -v.

Make sure to pick npm, followed by -v.

lessons.title: npm init
lessons.interactiveContent:
To create a project using Node we must initialize the project.

A project can be created using the command npm init in the terminal.

Make sure to pick npm, followed by init.

lessons.title: npm install
lessons.interactiveContent:
To install packages, type npm install or npm i followed by the package name.

For example, let's install x, a package that you may find useful.

Make sure to pick npm, followed by install, and finally x.

lessons.title: Lesson #14
lessons.interactiveContent: Did you know? At Mimo, we handle package management for you. If you head to the projects section, you can install packages without NPM.
